Star Thompson jailed after smashing car through Richmond home, narrowly missing couple https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/star-thompson-jailed-after-smashing-car-through-richmond-home-narrowly-missing- Couple/J6KYGSEWMFH2JD55NSL76UI4JM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/star-thompson-jailed-after-smashing-car-through-richmond-home-narrowly-missing- Couple/J6KYGSEWMFH2JD55NSL76UI4JM/ Tracy NealShe narrowly missed the sleeping elderly couple's bedroom and cannot pay for the damage. ‘Heartbreaking’: Historical report reveals council’s acquisition of land where water supply system is located https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/heartwriting-historical-report-reveals-councils-acquisition-of-land-where-water-supply-system-is- located/CAPGQBW7WJE2FKJJHJ6UW2XWQI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/gisborne-herald/news/heartwriting-historical-report-reveals-councils-acquisition-of-land-where-water-supply-system-is- located/CAPGQBW7WJE2FKJJHJ6UW2XWQI/ Zita CampbellGisborne adopts a new strategy after revealing historical land disputes. Thu, 19 Dec 2024 04:00:00 +0000 The Waingake-Pamoa joint steering group at Gisborne District Council last Thursday after the adoption of a strategic direction for Maraetahu Incorporated and the council to work towards mutual benefits on land acquired by the council since the early 1900s. From left are council regional biodiversity transformation manager Amy England, councillor Aubrey Ria, Gisborne Mayor Rehette Stoltz, Diana Kemp of Maraetaha, steering group member Daiminn Kemp, Manu Kemp of Maraetaha, council chief executive Nedine Thatcher Swann, Maraetaha Incorporated chairwoman Bella Hawkins, Maraetaha Inc trustee and strategic direction author Beth Tupara-Katene, councillor Debbie Gregory and Gisborne Deputy Mayor Josh Wharehinga. Photo / Zita Campbell
